New Records: Jason Holder took four wickets in successive balls, a feat achieved only by three other men in T20 internationals
Key Match Events: Jason Holder removed Chris Jordan and Sam Billings with his second and third legitimate deliveries via catches at deep midwicket
Holder then had Adil Rashid taken at deep square leg and ended the match when he bowled Saqib Mahmood
West Indies captain Kieron Pollard led a late run-spree with a rapid 41 not out in a total of 179 for four
Pre-Game Insights: Moeen was again leading an England side missing injured captain Eoin Morgan, with the tourists deprived all series of T20 regulars Jos Buttler and Ben Stokes following their Ashes exertions
Post-Match Reflections: Moeen thought West Indies were the better team
They were smarter than us today with bat and ball
Pollard said it was a total team effort from us
Holder said he prided himself on not bowling no-balls, pleased with how he came back, bowled a dot ball next up and then they had to come hard so he got the four wickets
Miscellaneous Highlights: Holder finished with a career-best return of five for 27 in 2.5 overs, having already removed England stand-in captain Moeen Ali
Holder was named both player of the match and series after taking 15 wickets across the five games
West Indies, beaten by 34 runs in the fourth T20 on Saturday, enjoyed a much-needed success after a one-day international series loss at home to Ireland earlier this month
Others: The match was played at the Kensington Oval in Bridgetown, Barbados
The series was a 5-match series between West Indies and England, with West Indies winning 3-2
